events.comment:
This example is based on other inventory example by https://forum.gdevelop-app.com/u/ddabrahim can be found here https://gametemplates.itch.io/gdevelop-examples
The example is using the inventory extension, so there is not many things to explain. 

Each inventory_slot object got 2 object variables which is generated at initialization, not manually added:
nameofitem: to store name of item displayed in the slot
ID: used in save and load only to identify slots

Also each inventory slot got multiple animations for display items. Each animation comes with a name equal to item name, so it very straight forward. If the slot need to display "cherry" it animation change to "cherry".

Each slot also has a text which is created at initialization and each text display the number of items in the inventory by simply using the name of the item displayed in the slot. If the slot displaying "cherry", we simply display the number of "cherry" stored in the inventory

Each item object is part of the items group for easy use
Each item object got two object variable:
name: to store name of item, so when we collect the item we can just pass the item name to the inventory
quantity: how many items included, for example in case of ammo, we propably need to collect more than 1 bullet

All inventory object is located on a layer called "inventory" so that we can simply show and hide inventory by show and hide the layer, also check layer visibility in case we want to do something for example use item and drag item only if the layer/inventory is visible.

events.name: Groups colors guide, this is for you to know which means each colored group

events.comment: Game running
Regular help blocks
Setting ups groups, create objects and externals
Always running
Change as you like in the inventory events, when you use an item you must set there what to do.
You can use or remove the red groups
Close button

objects.name: txt_controls
objects.string:
MAIN  MENU:
Use the mouse to select an action.

INVENTORY:
Use the mouse to hover the items.
Left click to add an item to the inventory.
Right click to use an item.
Use Save & Load buttons to trigger that actions.

SHOP:
Use the mouse to hover the items.
Left click to select the item, the selector will stop blinking, then press the "Buy" button to buy the selected item.

events.comment:
The game state logic
You can find 3 states here "running", "inventory","shop","controls"
Depending on the state shows or hide layers.
Go through each slot and write item name from each slot in to file and use item name to wrtie number of item from inventory in to file
If save exists for any inventory_slot in the scene
Reset inventory, delete all items
Read number and name of item stored for each inventory slot using their ID variable
Pass item name to slot and set animation of slot to display the item
Add the items to the inventory and update slot_text to display number of items in the inventory
prepare counter to add ID values to each inventory_slot, the ID is used when saving and loading the inventory
create a drag object at the mouse, it is used when we drag items in the inventory

for each inventory_slot object
-create a text to display number of items in the inventory, also link each text to it own slot
-add object variable nameofitem to store item name displayed in the slot
-add ID variable and set it value to be equal to counter
-increase counter
Link load_inventory event here in case you wish to load previously saved inventory at start
For each text: take in to account inventory_slot linked to text and update text to display the number of items in the inventory
pointer object follow position of mouse

events.name: Collect items and add to inventory

events.comment: If item is clicked, pick it name from object variable and pass the name to the picked_item variable
Look for a slot that already display the same item as picked
in case a slot is found, add item to inventory
update slot text to display the correct number of items in the slot/inventory
finally, delete item from the scene and reset picked_item variable

In case, there is no slot with the same item displayed as picked, look for a free slot
In case free slot is found, pass the item name to the slot and set the animaton of the slot to display the item
add item to inventory
update slot text to display correct number of items in the slot
delete picked item from scene and reset picked_item variable
Uncomment this link if you want to auto save the inventory | or | Remove this if you don't want to save the inventory
If the inventory layer is visible (in case you may want to hide the inventory at some point in your game)
If right mouse button is released and mouse is over a slot

if the number of items in the inventory with the name stored in the slot is > 0, remove an item from the inventory and 
update text of slot to display the correct number of items

PUT HERE WHAT DO YOU WANT TO DO WITH THE ITEM:

If it hp_potion: do something
if it mp_potion : do something else
and so on...
in case there is no more items in the inventory with the name stored in the slot, set animation of slot to empty and reset variable of slot
Uncomment this link if you want to auto save the inventory | or | Remove this if you don't want to save the inventory
If the inventory layer is visible (in case you may want to hide the inventory at some point in your game)
If left mouse button is down and mouse is over inventory slot
If the number of items in the inventory with the name stored in the slot is > 0
Copy item name to pointer_dragobject and set inventory slot to empty
If left mouse button is released and mouse is over slot
if slot is empty
If there is something stored in the pointer object, copy item name from pointer to slot and reset pointer object
if slot is NOT empty

If there is something stored in the pointer object:
copy item name from slot to a scene variable
copy item name from mouse to slot
copy item name from scene variable to slot
Uncomment this link if you want to auto save the inventory | or | Remove this if you don't want to save the inventory
Add a title, description into a box for the hover item
If the inventory layer is visible (in case you may want to hide the inventory at some point in your game)
If mouse is released and mouse object got something stored and mouse is over the bin, remove item from the pointer object and also from inventory
Uncomment this link if you want to auto save the inventory | or | Remove this if you don't want to save the inventory
change bin animation
Set up the selector for buy items
Set the selector animation to selected and start the timer to keep the selector in that state until the next click, so the player can click buy button to buy an item.
If coins > item price then buy the item.
Uncomment this link if you want to auto save the inventory | or | Remove this if you don't want to save the inventory
A timer so the selector keep in selected state until the next click

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: UlisesFreitas<ulises.freitas@gmail.com>
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: Wait a determinate number of seconds to perform the next action.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Wait

parameters.description: Set a name for Wait timer
parameters.name: WaitTimerName

eventsFunctions.name: WaitCondition
eventsFunctions.sentence: Wait the action by _PARAM1_ for the timer _PARAM2_

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (tristan@victrisgames.com)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
This extension can be used to create multiple copies of an object in a wide variety of arrangements, including:
- horizontal row(s)
- vertical column(s)
- a solid rectangle or square
- an evenly spaced grid
- a grid with different spacing between rows and columns

After the objects are created, you can reference their object variables to manage the objects:

* `RowID`:  what horizontal row does this object reside in,
* `ColumnID`:  what vertical column does this object reside in,
* `CreationID`:  starting top-left, and proceeding from left to right, what is the number of the created object,
* `BatchID`:  optional identifier assigned to all objects created

Watch this [tutorial video](https://youtu.be/rlGSlNSRR9w) to see examples of how to use this extension.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.fullName: Create multiple copies of an object
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: CreateMultipleCopiesOfObject
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Select the object, choose the number of rows and columns, the spacing between rows and columns, the top left starting point, the layer to create the objects on, and the z-order of the objects.

eventsFunctions.description:
Create multiple copies of an object.
Select the object, choose the number of rows and columns, the spacing between rows and columns, the top left starting point, the layer to create the objects on, and the z-order of the objects.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Create multiple copies of an object
eventsFunctions.name: CreateMultipleCopiesOfObject
eventsFunctions.sentence: Create _PARAM2_ rows and _PARAM3_ columns of _PARAM1_ objects, with top-left starting position _PARAM4_;_PARAM5_, with _PARAM6_px between rows and _PARAM7_px between columns. Create objects on _PARAM9_ with a Z-value of _PARAM10_. Assign all objects the BatchID of _PARAM8_.

events.comment: Temp object is created to record its width and height (which is needed to calculate spacing).
Temp variables to track progress in drawing the grid
Starting at top left, create objects in grid.
If the current row is complete, move to the next row.
If the last row is complete, stop creating new objects.

parameters.description: (Optional) Identifier assigned to all objects created in this batch
parameters.name: BatchID

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: westboy, daliyoucefmedakram@gmail.com, @bouh
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Animate the text to simulate it being written character by character (also called "typewriter" effect), with a customizable time between each character. Useful for dialogue scenes or visual novels.

Add the behavior to a Text object (BBText, Bitmap Text object) and choose the interval between characters.

* When the text changes, the automatic typing starts again from the beginning with the new text.
* You can change the speed of the text typing by changing the interval with events.
* Use a condition to check if the typing finished.
* You can also pause the typing and resume it after.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.fullName: Auto typing animation for texts ("typewriter" effect)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: AutoTyping
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Animate the text to simulate it being written character by character (also called "typewriter" effect), with a customizable time between each character. Useful for dialogue scenes or visual novels.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Animate the text to simulate it being written character by character (also called "typewriter" effect), with a customizable time between each character. Add the behavior to the object, and it will get animated when the text is changed. You can also pause/resume it.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Text_AutoTyping

eventsFunctions.description: Execute actions when the auto typing text ends.
eventsFunctions.name: TypingFinished

eventsFunctions.description: Detect if the auto typing is on pause.
eventsFunctions.name: TypingPause

eventsFunctions.description: Change the time between characters being typed.
eventsFunctions.name: ChangeInterval
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set the interval between characters of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_
